DataElement.preferredName: Neurology Essential Tremor Sign Assessment Description Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the branch of medical science that deals with the study of structure, function, and diseases of the nervous system; for thorough searching also see NEUROSCIENCE, MENTAL DISORDER, NERVOUS SYSTEM DISORDER, NERVOUS SYSTEM DISORDER DIAGNOSIS, MENTAL DISORDER DIAGNOSIS, NERVOUS SYSTEM DISORDER CHEMOTHERAPY, COMMUNICATION DISORDER, NEUROMUSCULAR DISORDER._Absolutely or vitally necessary; indispensable._The shaking movement of the whole body or just a certain part of it, often caused by problems of the neurons responsible for muscle action._Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining physician._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something._The words of something written.

ReferenceDocuments.name: An examination to assess esse
ReferenceDocuments.description: An examination to assess essential tremor, which is involuntary movement of one or more body parts, such as the head, arms, or legs.
